intro: Aspidosperma bicolor, commonly known as the yellow-wood tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and green foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark is thick and often fissured, and it is known for its slow growth and long lifespan. Aspidosperma bicolor is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
